result.reason: This is a reproducible data-loss bug where MSSQL varchar columns convert non-Latin characters to '?', so Unicode storage needs a schema fix.
result.approach: Add an MSSQL migration that converts text-bearing columns from varchar to nvarchar, bump the SQL schema version, and add a regression test validating non-Latin round-trip persistence.

attempts.raw_output: {"decision":"implement","reason":"This is a reproducible data-loss bug where MSSQL varchar columns convert non-Latin characters to '?', so Unicode storage needs a schema fix.","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Config/Serializers/ConnectionSerializers/Sql/SqlDatabaseMetaDataRetriever.cs","mRemoteNG/Config/Serializers/Versioning/SqlDatabaseVersionVerifier.cs","mRemoteNG/Config/Serializers/Versioning/SqlVersion31To32Upgrader.cs","mRemoteNGTests/Config/Serializers/Versioning/SqlVersion31To32UpgraderTests.cs"],"approach":"Add an MSSQL migration that converts text-bearing columns from varchar to nvarchar, bump the SQL schema version, and add a regression test validating non-Latin round-trip persistence."}
